Sentencas: Sr-substituted ABO(3) perovskite oxides such as La0.6Sr0.4MnO3-delta (LSM) and La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-delta (LSF) are widely used as oxygen electrode materials in solid oxide cells.
Titulo: Study of the relationship between the local geometric structure and the stability of La0.6Sr0.4MnO3-δ and La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ electrodes

Sentencas: The substituted Sr is not adequately stable under the operating conditions, because of the surface segregation of Sr.
Titulo: Study of the relationship between the local geometric structure and the stability of La0.6Sr0.4MnO3-δ and La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ electrodes

Sentencas: Herein, we focused on investigating the relationship between the local geometric structure due to Sr substitution and stability of LSM and LSF.
Titulo: Study of the relationship between the local geometric structure and the stability of La0.6Sr0.4MnO3-δ and La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ electrodes

Sentencas: We characterized the local geometric structure of Sr atoms via X-ray absorption spectroscopy.
Titulo: Study of the relationship between the local geometric structure and the stability of La0.6Sr0.4MnO3-δ and La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ electrodes

Sentencas: A greater Debye-Waller factor and a longer bond length of both the second and third Sr-O shells were observed in LSF, which demonstrates that LSF has a higher local structural disorder and that Sr in LSF requires less energy to segregate.
Titulo: Study of the relationship between the local geometric structure and the stability of La0.6Sr0.4MnO3-δ and La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ electrodes

Sentencas: After 20 h of heat treatment in the presence of a Fe-Cr alloy interconnect, the Sr/La molar ratio on LSF was observed to be much larger than that on LSM.
Titulo: Study of the relationship between the local geometric structure and the stability of La0.6Sr0.4MnO3-δ and La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ electrodes

Sentencas: This result unequivocally suggests that Sr in LSF is not as stable as in LSM, and the reaction between Sr and Cr accelerates the Sr surface segregation in LSF.
Titulo: Study of the relationship between the local geometric structure and the stability of La0.6Sr0.4MnO3-δ and La0.6Sr0.4FeO3-δ electrodes
